stx.js.io.IFrameIO

type
interface
A bidirectional communication layer capable of crossing frames hosted on different domains.

Instance Methods

receive(f : Dynamic -> Void, originUrl : String, ?originWindow : stx.js.Window) : IFrameIO

parameters
f The function that will be passed each message.
originUrl The URL where the messages will come from, including the query string but without the hash tag.
originWindow The window that the messages will come from. If this parameter is not specified, reliable reception from the origin window is not possible.
Adds a receiver that will handle messages from the given domain.

receiveRequests(f : Dynamic -> stx.Future<Dynamic>, url : String, window : stx.js.Window) : IFrameIO

parameters
f The function that will receive and responde to requests.
url The URL of the target/source window, including the query string but without the hash tag.
window The window of the target/source window.
Receives and responds to requests with the specified function.

receiveWhile(f : Dynamic -> Bool, originUrl : String, ?originWindow : stx.js.Window) : IFrameIO

parameters
f The function that will be passed each message.
originUrl The URL where the messages will come from, including the query string but without the hash tag.
originWindow The window that the messages will come from. If this parameter is not specified, reliable reception from the origin window is not possible.
Adds a receiver that will handle messages from the given domain for as long as it returns true.

request(request : Dynamic, targetUrl : String, targetWindow : stx.js.Window) : stx.Future<Dynamic>

parameters
request The anonymous object that will be sent.
targetUrl The exact URL the message is being sent to, including host, port, path, and query, but excluding hash tag.
targetWindow The window that will receive the message.
Sends a request for information to the specified iframe, which should be located at the exact URL specified.

send(data : Dynamic, targetUrl : String, targetWindow : stx.js.Window) : IFrameIO

parameters
data The anonymous object that will be sent.
targetUrl The exact URL the message is being sent to, including host, port, path, and query, but excluding hash tag.
targetWindow The window that will receive the message.
Posts a message to the specified iframe, which should be located at the exact URL specified.
